title: If auto-range is supposed to be Caitlyn's niche
body:
Why does Jinx have 700 range rockets at Rank 5 Q?
Edit, yes I forgot about Trist. Which is just as much of a valid argument as jinx

replies.body: Because Jinx's niche is being better than everyone else.

> [{quoted}](name=Red Death LoL,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aGEAleXs,comment-id=0001000100010000,timestamp=2015-10-12T03:12:40.487+0000)

Gutted means made unviable, the words/phrases you're looking for are: nerfed, toned down, balanced, weakened, and/or made equal to other champions.
That isn't necessarily true.  I'm a software developer and I use the word gutted any time I have to drastically rewrite something. In the end, it works better, but it isn't the same as it used to be.

> [{quoted}](name=The Illithid,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aGEAleXs,comment-id=000100010001000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-12T21:29:11.057+0000)
>
> That isn't necessarily true.  I'm a software developer and I use the word gutted any time I have to drastically rewrite something. In the end, it works better, but it isn't the same as it used to be.

Let me rephrase, in league terms gutted means made unviable, basically 'olaf'ed'. While I'm sure you're not wrong, words can have different meanings in different places (like mad (angry) vs mad (insane).)

True, words can mean different things in different places, I just meant that perhaps the person Chromatic Eagle was talking to views the word the same way I do. A lot of people post on the boards, and maybe the person posting should have used a different way of explaining what they meant, given the perceptions on the boards. However, I would argue that the more general definition of the word is the way I see it, and that the League boards have superimposed their own, narrower, negative connotation on top of the true definition. Therefore, I don't think it is wrong to say that a champ should be gutted and mean that the champion should receive an update which includes significant changes even to the point of the kit being almost entirely remade, while also still remaining completely viable.

> [{quoted}](name=Hayaishi2,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aGEAleXs,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-10-11T17:49:58.136+0000)
>
> Because Jinx's niche is being better than everyone else.

Confirmed by Riot. "We made this champion to be the best at grouping and pushing, which we acknowledge is 90% of solo queue".

auto range isn't Caitlyn's niche, it's her overall safety (ability to escape, traps, and the range on her q and r).  I imagine if they could, they would give Cait 700 auto range but realize that would be toxic to lane with so early in the game.
Well right now it's 650, it's not that far from it. But the rocket being shot from a greater distance than the sniper rifle makes no sense.
I am not sure if a sniper rifle can be shot further than a small-sized rocket, but since when has League of Legends made any scientific or logical sense before?
Well since Trist's canon shoots further than both while still maintaining perfect homing accuracy I guess ur right lol.
Kennen can throw a shuriken farther than Lucian can shoot a gun. Logic?
Lucian just has REALLY bad aim

"Luck? I call it good aim"

No no Lucian. If you had good aim you would be able to hit globally. But nope. You can only hit from shotgun range. That is not good aim.

You have to consider that they're both consistently moving in combat. Snipers don't exactly have much time to line up a shot when you're on the run. Couple that with rockets having a respectable firing range *and* a blast zone, and it makes some sense in this context.

Now, if Caitlyn could increase her attack range by standing still, it would make even more sense.
She does increase her range by standing still... She presses R and gets a hit from across the map.

I honestly wish they'd give her ult global range, with the same projectile travel speed. The cross-map snipes would be absolutely epic LOL

I would be ok with the rockets if they would up the mana cost by **a lot**

> [{quoted}](name=Eedat,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aGEAleXs,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-10-11T18:15:23.515+0000)
>
> I would be ok with the rockets if they would up the mana cost by **a lot**

This makes the most sense to me. Like Ezreal, she should be a candidate for tear if she is going to primarily rely on rockets.

Gating someone's mana to the point of needing a Tear because you're butt-hurt? Holy fuck guys get real, it deals 10% damage and has lower attack-speed, the machine gun was more powerful which is why it got nerfed!  Take the rocket out of your butt and calm down

You must be having a bad day lol. It deals 110% damage, not 10% damage. It also doesn't have a decay on the splash damage, and the splash can crit. I don't think jinx should be nerfed any other way than simply adding a slightly higher mana cost to her rocket use. Any other way might gut her damage too much.
Wow 10% extra damage that she can't use simultaneously with the bonus AS in her kit, holy shit, it's almost as good as the champs with much higher damage available earlier!

But they don't have her range or the rocket's splash damage. You seem to love isolating one thing about your disagreements, which is foolish and near-sighted. Jinx's rockets as a whole are very powerful. The safety, damage output, splash damage for teamfights, and crit to ensure no wasted gold or awkward builds makes them a no-brainer, particularly late game.

I'm not saying she's wildly overpowered, nor am I saying her rockets are wildly overpowered. But next to vayne and trist, shes the only ADC I ever really see anymore. Personally, I'm of the mindset that if you see 2 or three ADCs all the time, they're probably a bit too strong. Raising the mana costs on her rockets wouldn't do anything to her damage output at all, especially if it scaled into late game, making her early game rockets cost the same as they do now.

Her main thing is long range aoe damage. Why would you nerf that? Nerf something else. 
That's like saying we should make Vayne's silver bolts do half the damage.

No, that means her rockets are a teamfight skill instead of a do-all skill, which is now. Currently isnt THE safest adc, but she is the safest and less abusable hypercarry by a longshot. She has extreme ranges at good mana costs, and the only adc with hard cc on basic ability. Her rockets give her too much poke, safe farming and wavecleaning power, on top of being a strong teamfight weapon.

She is the safest hypercarry, and the strongest utility adc.

The nerf is to mana, not damage, so your Vayne comparison is not valid at all.

I am going to ask. What is point of picking Ashe or Varus when Jinx does everything better?

Ashe has perma slow and global hawkshot. Varus has tank shredding abilities, without really having and armor pen (but it really helps).

Jinx is cool, but Ashe is the Queen of ICEEEEEEEEEE.

Perma slow in league of dashes is vastly overrated. And global hawkshot IS nice, but generally not that worthy to mention.

And Varus' itemization is a mess - yeah he shreds with his W - but only if you level up W second - but then you lose your only defense and reliable poke.

Riot mentioned emphasizing caitlin's sniper thematic especially her range and traps when they do the marksman update, I'm hoping that they'll take this chance to do something like giving her much increased auto range when standing in a position( like stand still a few seconds and then gain double auto range until you move, or stand on a trap, or stand in a bush because we already have the headshot passive thing and maybe we could double down on that) or make her ultimate do less damage on a much shorter cooldown or with some cooldown reducing mechanic.

I always thought range AND safety were Cait's niche.

Early game range is her niche. Not her fault people don't try to harass in lane.

With Cait you're supposed to bully your lane opponents and take towers/drags with that lead. Her range means considerably less lategame with her weak AA scaling.
